contentrichtext.text: <!-- This article was auto-generated by [[User:Polbot]]. --> {{Taxobox | name = Bolitoglossa diminuta | image = | status = VU | status_system = IUCN3.1 | regnum = [[Animalia]] | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Amphibia]] | ordo = [[Caudata]] | familia = [[Plethodontidae]] | genus = ''[[Bolitoglossa]]'' | species = '''''B. diminuta''''' | binomial = ''Bolitoglossa diminuta'' | binomial_authority = [[Herbert Christopher Robinson|Robinson]], 1976 | synonyms = }} The '''Quebrada Valverde Salamander''' ('''''Bolitoglossa diminuta''''') is a species of [[salamander]] in the [[Plethodontidae]] family. It is [[Endemism|endemic]] to [[Costa Rica]]. Its natural [[habitat]] is subtropical or tropical moist [[montane forest]]s. ==References== * BolaÃ±os, F., Wake, D & Savage, J. 2004. [http://www.iucnredlist.org/search/details.php/59155/all Bolitoglossa diminuta]. [http://www.iucnredlist.org 2012 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. ] Downloaded on 11 October 2012.
